GSD.attack_vector: social engineering to save an image file
GSD.description: This report appears to be incorrect, the original tweet was deleted and a new tweet was posted indicating that the reporter made an error, and that the URL was in fact loaded due to "Firefox’s recent shortcuts on the home screen" functionality. The original text of this report is: In Apple Mac OS version 12.6 a reported information disclosure exists in the background photo processing (e.g. searching for known faces, indexing files by time and location taken) that can be attacked via social engineering, e.g. if an image with a QR code is saved and then processed Mac OS will reportedly process the QR code data, and if it is a URL it will load the URL disclosing information about the system (user agent, IP address, etc.).
